etymology.description: Originally 隹(隹) (zhuī, "short-tailed bird") -> 唯(唯) (wéi) with 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") added -> phonetic 唯(唯) (wéi) + semantic 鳥(鳥) (niǎo, "bird") -> 鷕(鷕) (yǎo, "cry of a bird")
etymology.interpretation: The character 鷕(鷕) (yǎo) is a phono-semantic compound where 唯(唯) (wéi) acts as the phonetic component and 鳥(鳥) (niǎo) provides the semantic meaning related to birds, representing the sound or cry made by birds.

examples.chinese: 清晨听到鷕(鷕)，使人心情舒畅(使人心情舒暢)。
examples.pinyin: Qīngchén tīng dào yǎo, shǐ rén xīnqíng shūchàng.
examples.english: Hearing the cry of a bird in the early morning makes people feel cheerful.

examples.chinese: 在树林中回响鷕(鷕)，唤起远古记忆(唤起遠古記憶)。
examples.pinyin: Zài shùlín zhōng huíxiǎng yǎo, huànqǐ yuǎngǔ jìyì.
examples.english: In the forest, the bird's cry echoes and evokes ancient memories.
